transcript.text: Thank you Madam President.
Prime Minister, welcome to Strasbourg. The Swedish presidency
opens in a context – as you have recalled – of major crisis,
and I would like to thank you because in this context, you are
demonstrating with your government that it is possible to repair Europe .
You said it, you want a greener, safer, freer Europe.
Greener, not by less work and science, but on the contrary by relying,
as you do, on the best of European genius, and in particular on
the nuclear industry which will enable us to count on carbon-free energy tomorrow.
Safer, not by managing our impotence and by distributing the quotas of illegal migrants
who we will not have been able to prevent from arriving in Europe, but on the contrary by controlling our borders.
And of course freer, and you are a strong voice in saying that it is
not because we spend more public money that we strengthen the prosperity of
our societies. It's only because we liberate creativity and
leave our States where they are, in their role and their responsibilities.
Prime Minister, today we are faced with
essential challenges. Selma Lagerlöf said in The Wonderful Journey of Nils Holgersson,
that “intelligence and wisdom make beggars among princes”. On the contrary, we do not doubt
for a moment that you will be able to demonstrate this intelligence and this wisdom,
and you can count on your political family, on the EPP, to support you in this
way. Despite all the adversities and sometimes, unfortunately, despite the denials of reality that
continue to thrive in our European institutions, we need a strong Swedish Presidency
to be able to prepare Europe and strengthen it in the terrible international context
that we are experiencing. Prime Minister. Lycka till! Good luck.
